meanings.definition: Make (something) seem less important or significant.
meanings.sent1: She trivializes the importance of studying by saying it's not necessary.
meanings.sent2: He often trivializes the efforts of his teammates, which can be demotivating.
meanings.sent3: The way she trivializes the value of money is quite amusing to her friends.
meanings.sent4: His constant joking trivializes the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The movie scene trivializes the danger of the wild animals.

meanings.sent1: The teacher trivializes mistakes to encourage students to keep trying.
meanings.sent2: It's not right to trivialize the impact of climate change on future generations.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally trivializes the importance of the meeting by forgetting her notes.
meanings.sent4: His dismissive attitude trivializes the efforts of those who worked hard.
meanings.sent5: The news report trivializes the severity of the natural disaster.
